understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getCompactionLargePartitionWarningThreshold() which returns a long value converted from a configuration parameter conf.compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb using ByteUnit.MEBI_BYTES.toBytes() method.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration parameter compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb which is used to set the threshold for logging a warning when compacting partitions larger than this value.

config_description: Log a warning when compacting partitions larger than this value
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb' is used in the code to check if the size of a row exceeds the threshold set by 'DatabaseDescriptor.getCompactionLargePartitionWarningThreshold()'. If the row size is larger than the threshold, a warning message is logged.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the configuration depends on the size of the rows being compacted. If there are large partitions that exceed the threshold, the configuration will be triggered for those specific cases.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb' configuration is to provide a warning when compacting partitions larger than the specified threshold. This can help in identifying and addressing potential performance issues related to large partitions in the system.
